intro: Micranthes aprica, commonly known as the spring sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the mustard family (Brassicaceae) and typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during early spring. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. Micranthes aprica is often found in open, disturbed habitats and is considered a rare species in many areas.
